intro: Lepyrodia verruculosa, commonly known as the woolly lepidote, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Brazil and Argentina. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright stems, which are often covered in soft, woolly hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-white in color and bloom during the spring and summer months. Lepyrodia verruculosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
